summary: This document is an email chain from May 2018 regarding a camera upgrade for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It involves employees of SigNet Technologies and a US Department of Justice communication technician discussing technical specifications and quotes for camera equipment.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.context: Employee of SigNet Technologies involved in sales correspondence regarding camera equipment for the MCC facility.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Employee of SigNet Technologies managing Federal Bureau of Prisons contracts, clarifying camera specifications in the email chain.

connections.description: Co-workers at SigNet Technologies collaborating on a federal contract for camera equipment.

events.title: Camera Specification Clarification
events.description: Email exchange clarifying that the Axis Q6000-E camera is not a PTZ camera, leading to a discussion of providing an alternate quote.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The correspondence is related to a camera upgrade project for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in May 2018.
SigNet Technologies, a contractor, was involved in providing camera equipment to the US Department of Justice.
The email chain shows technical procurement discussions, including clarification that a specific camera model was not a PTZ type.
The document is routine procurement correspondence and does not directly reference Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any associated individuals.
